column5: Hey everyone, just got word last night. The Cobourg fish lift will be held this SATURDAY, APRIL, 13. They are asking volunteers to be there by 8:30.  Directions:  From Toronto: Take Burnham St. Exit and go south, Go east on Elgin St, turn left on Ontario St, park in "The Mill" parking lot.  From Kingston: Take Division St. exit and go south, go west on Elgin St., turn right on Ontario St., park in "The Mill" parking lot.
Good Stuff Ron  No Promises--will pass this along !  Can usually find a couple of dudes willing to get wet..........for the cause  TightLines   Paul
I was wondering the same thing...lol just didnt wonna sound like a noob.  :s
Unfortunately it doesn't look I can make this year  It's a great event to help lift steelhead over the dam.  It's your chance to unleash the inner Loogan
Thats cool, cant imagine it being hard to find volunteers...
Are you sure Ron, just received an email from Margaret (MNR) and she says its a week from this, Saturday April 13th starting at 9:00am, and meeting at Pratts Dam
Excellent event! If I wasn't busy this weekend, I would definitely be there.  Only day in a year, when you are allowed to net fish without being fined.
Your right Steve,  It was originally planned for this weekend but with the weather forecast, they postponed til the 13th. I just got word myself @ 12:30. Earliest I could get back to the puter.....
Thanks for posting those pics MJL. That pretty much answers all the questions.
If I was'nt working nights I would be all over this
''It's your chance to unleash the inner Loogan'' Now that's funny
Cool Pics...appears this event is well attended/managed.Kindly post here should you feel you require some hands up on the 13th Ron. Thanks  www.ontario.ca/livingwithwildlife
THE FISH LIFT HAS BEEN CANCELLED this year due to high flows, cold temperatures and rain.
Next Year Maybe?  Appreciate your follow up here Ron  Have a warm weekend All  TightLines  Paul
